calculator.title: Semester Grade Calculator
calculator.intro: This tool is designed to automatically calculate semester grades for universities in Azerbaijan. After entering seminar, colloquium, attendance, and independent work indicators, the system calculates the final grade according to the official formula.
calculator.errorDescription: You have exceeded the maximum allowed absences for this course. You are not allowed to take the exam.
calculator.faqQ1: What formula does the calculator use?
calculator.faqA1: The calculator works according to the standard grading system of universities in Azerbaijan. Formula: (Seminar average × 0.4 + Colloquium average × 0.6) × 3 + Attendance + Independent work (0-10). Maximum score is 50.
calculator.faqQ2: How is the attendance score calculated?
calculator.faqA2: The attendance system works based on rules for absent hours. Each course has specific allowed absence limits and score tables based on total hours (30, 45, 60, 75, 90, 105). For example, in a 60-hour course: 1 absence=10 points, 2-3 absences=9 points, 4-7 absences=8 points. If you have 8 or more absences, you are not allowed to take the exam.
calculator.faqQ3: How are seminar and colloquium scores considered?
calculator.faqA3: The average of seminar grades is multiplied by 0.4, while the average of colloquium grades is multiplied by 0.6. This shows that colloquiums have more weight. Then these two numbers are added and multiplied by 3 to get a maximum of 30 points.
calculator.faqQ4: Which universities is this tool suitable for?
calculator.faqA4: This calculator is currently designed for Baku State University (BSU). The grading system applied at other universities may differ and results may not be accurate.
calculator.faqQ5: How is the accuracy of calculations ensured?
calculator.faqA5: The calculator is programmed according to official university rules. All calculations are performed locally in your browser in a transparent manner. No personal information is collected or sent to servers. You are responsible for the accuracy of the information you enter.
calculator.faqQ6: Does it work on mobile devices?
calculator.faqA6: Yes, the site is fully responsive and works perfectly on all devices (phone, tablet, computer). The user interface is specially optimized for mobile screens.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.a1: Enter your seminar and colloquium grades. The calculator automatically calculates the average (Seminar × 0.4 + Colloquium × 0.6), multiplies it by 3, and adds attendance and independent work points.
faq.a2: Attendance score: 10 - (10 × absent hours / total hours). For example, if you miss 6 out of 60 hours: 10 - (10 × 6/60) = 9 points.
faq.a3: The maximum score is 50: Base score (30) + Attendance (10) + Independent work (10).
faq.q4: What is the minimum passing grade?
faq.a4: Typically the minimum passing grade in universities is 26, but this may vary depending on university and department requirements.
faq.a5: No, all calculations are performed locally in your browser. No data is sent to the server.
faq.q6: Can I use it on mobile?
faq.a6: Yes, the site is fully responsive and works on all devices (phone, tablet, computer).
faq.q7: How can I save the result?
faq.a7: After the result appears, you can take a screenshot or note down the information.
faq.q8: What should I do if the calculator gives wrong results?
faq.a8: First check the information you entered. If the problem persists, contact us through the Contact page.
